wiki.content: "Stan" tells the fictional story of a fan who is obsessed with Eminem and writes to him without receiving a reply. The first three verses are delivered by Eminem as Stan, while the fourth verse is Eminem attempting to write to Stan, only to realize that he had already heard about Stan's death on the news. This song samples the song Thank You by Dido. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: "Stan" tells the fictional story of a fan who is obsessed with Eminem and writes to him without receiving a reply. The first three verses are delivered by Eminem as Stan, while the fourth verse is Eminem attempting to write to Stan, only to realize that he had already heard about Stan's death on the news. This song samples the song Thank You by Dido.

track.name: Stan
comments: So...they censored "cut" but not "shit?" I don't understand this clean bullshit. Take a song the way it's made or don't listen to it. Great song though.

A very sad story, great song.
a great artist and their work are always unique, this is a prime example. Great story
This song has everything that, in my opinion, defines a truly great song. Perfect verses, perfect lyrics, perfect chorus, perfect melancholic beat... This song is timeless.
i'm not a big eminem fan, but this is undoubtedly one of the greatest hiphop songs ever. so compelling i stop what i'm doing to listen to it.
